page.title: 10LOWER HADDON FARM & STABLES
page.content: Father and son manage the{racing {stables}whilst another son runs the farming side. The{farmhouse}is{400} years old. The farmland was drained in the late 1930's but the soil is still heavy. There are stables for 25 horses and training costs around Â£100 a week. 5 or 6 grooms are employed. The farm also has{breeding mares}and rears its own{foals}. Horses flat race from 2-6 years and steeple chase until 11. The trainer attends race meetings regularly and takes{identity cards}for his horses and grooms for{security}. The horses are very valuable. A promising foal may be worth{Â£15,000}at 3 months. The farm is 122 hectares and employs 2 men. They grow 56H Winter Wheat,23H Winter Barley,4H Oats for horses. It costs Â£40,000 to grow 200 acres of corn. 25% of the cost is due to spraying.
